Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state B,$P_{B}=P_2$ and $V_{B}=V_1$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A,$P_{A}=P_1$ and $V_{A}=V_1$
According to the ideal gas equation of state $ rac{P_{A}V_{A}}{T_{A}}= rac{P_{B}V_{B}}{T_{B}}$, $T_{B}= rac{p_{2}v_{1}}{p_{1}v_{1}}T_{0}$ can be obtained
